ModInfo.Name: Postscriptthree's Gameplay Tweaks
ModInfo.Author: Postscriptthree
ModInfo.Description: A collection of gameplay adjustments and enhancements, built for compatibility with other mods whenever possible.
ModInfo.ReleaseNotes: Fixing a bug between party randomizer and battle randomizer.

ConfigOption.Name: ======Setting Presets======
ConfigOption.Description: There are a lot of options at this point, and it can be a pain to go through all of them. Choose a preset to quickly use a set of options. It will turn on those options and turn itself off after saving, then you can make additional changes if you want. If it turns off another mod, you can turn that mod back on after and hopefully the compatibility settings will take care of any conflicting options.

ConfigOption.Name: Vanilla Plus
ConfigOption.Description: Doesn't make drastic gameplay changes, but does turn on several options that enhance regular gameplay. Includes Limit Overhaul, Counters Add Effects and More Materia Pairs, Unlimited Sense and Show Steal/Morph, Show Effectiveness after Sensing, Show Bonuses on Equip Screen, and Use Luck for Stealing.

ConfigOption.Name: The Works
ConfigOption.Description: Turns on just about everything, barring challenge options. Includes True Wait Easy Run, Break Damage Limit with Level 4 Limits and Break HP Limit, Multi-Linked Slots set to Vanilla Equipment (change this if you're using other gameplay mods), Battle PHS, Limit Overhaul, Two Accessories, Counters Add Effects and More Materia Pairs, Auto Sense and Show Steals/Morphs, Show Effectiveness always, Show Bonuses on Equip Screen, Dialogue Turbo on Switch (square), EXP and AP Share, First Character Slot on world map, Enemy Speed Multiplier on 2x (good for True Wait), Use Luck for Steals, and Status Speed Multiplier on 2x (also good for True Wait).

ConfigOption.Name: Super Randomizer Challenge
ConfigOption.Description: This is a set of options designed to take the randomizer to the extreme. This enables most gameplay/QOL mods, giving you all the tools available to take on random strengthened enemies and double bosses with a level cap.

ConfigOption.Name: ======Randomizer======
ConfigOption.Description: All of the options for the Randomizer.

ConfigOption.Name: Enemy Randomizer
ConfigOption.Description: Randomizes bosses and random encounters with scaling. Boss scaling is based on the difficulty of the boss being replaced, and random encounter scaling is based on your party's average level. Bosses are shuffled around, so you won't see the same one in two places. Random encounters are totally random. The boss seed is generated when you select New Game.

ConfigOption.Name: Item Randomizer
ConfigOption.Description: Randomizes item and materia pickups, shops, and drops/steals/morphs. Drops/steals/morphs are weighted based on buy price. The seeds for items, materia, and shops are generated when you select New Game.

ConfigOption.Name: Double Bosses
ConfigOption.Description: Instead of every boss being replaced by a random boss, each boss will be replaced by two random bosses. Only applies with the Enemy Randomizer on.

ConfigOption.Name: Party Randomizer
ConfigOption.Description: Randomizes what characters are in the party at the start of every fight. Chooses from among the characters currently available in the PHS/materia exchange menu. Your out-of-battle party is locked whenever you have an illegal party, so if you want to change it, put all required characters in.

ConfigOption.Name: ======Gameplay Adjustments======
ConfigOption.Description: These options change the gameplay drastically in various ways.

ConfigOption.Name: True Wait Mode
ConfigOption.Description: Pauses the atb clock whenever any combatant has a full atb bar. Applies automatically if enabled here. Drastically changes the way the game feels, making combat more tactical and less about speedy inputs. Does not apply when running away from a battle.

ConfigOption.Name: Break Damage/HP Limit
ConfigOption.Description: Raises the damage limit to 99,999 and hp limit to 32,767. Can require knowing level 4 limit breaks to break the damage limit. HP limit breaks visually with some UI mods. Unlimited Damage increases the damage limit to 536,870,896, and doesn't require unlocking.

Option.Name: Break Damage Limit with lv4 limits
Break Damage Limit with lv4 limits and HP Limit
Break Damage Limit and HP Limit always
Unlimited Damage and upped HP Limit

ConfigOption.Name: Multi-Linked Slots Equipment
ConfigOption.Description: Modifies equipment to add Multi-Linked Slots. These let you link one materia to two other materia, using only three slots total. If using one of the listed mods, use that setting. If using New Threat 2.0, leave this option as "off" and turn the Multi-Linked Slots Enabler on. "Vanilla Equipment" also adds Morph As Well and AP Plus materia, though you'll need to start a new game to get them.

ConfigOption.Name: In-Battle PHS
ConfigOption.Description: Lets you swap characters mid-battle. Available after receiving the PHS. Your out-of-battle party is locked whenever you have an illegal party, so if you want to change it, put all required characters in.

ConfigOption.Name: Solo Challenge
ConfigOption.Description: Forces you to use one character throughout the game. Starting a new game initializes the character and is recommended. Your out-of-battle party is locked whenever you have an illegal party, so if you want to change it, put all required characters in and take any illegal characters out. If you use Sephiroth, don't recruit Vincent, since that will overwrite Sephiroth's stats and cause the game to crash.

ConfigOption.Name: Control Sephiroth
ConfigOption.Description: Lets you control Sephiroth during the flashback or always if using Sephiroth Solo Challenge. Also disables his invincibility. Is not compatible with mods that edit the kernel like New Threat, Echo-S, or Multilinked Slots. Doesn't add animations, so doing anything that Sephiroth can't normally do like using items will result in things not looking right.

ConfigOption.Name: Limit Command Rework
ConfigOption.Description: Instead of replacing the attack command, there is now a separate limit command. You can also choose any limit you've unlocked, and lower level limits cost less of the limit gauge to use. Tifa, Cait Sith, and Vincent's limits work like vanilla, but don't replace their attack command.

ConfigOption.Name: Two Accessories
ConfigOption.Description: Gives each character a second Accessory slot.

ConfigOption.Name: Counters Add Effects
ConfigOption.Description: Enables counters with paired materia to apply effects of additional paired materia. For example, pairing Magic Counter+Fire and HP Absorb+Fire results in countering with Fire that absorbs HP.

ConfigOption.Name: More Materia Pairs
ConfigOption.Description: Lets you pair double cut and slash all with support materia. Also lets you pair all with command materia.

ConfigOption.Name: ======Quality of Life/Convenience======
ConfigOption.Description: These options make the game more convenient and accessible/enjoyable without changing any core gameplay mechanics.

ConfigOption.Name: Instant ATB
ConfigOption.Description: Makes ATB time pass instantly between turns.

ConfigOption.Name: Sense Adjustments
ConfigOption.Description: Enables Sense on all enemies, regardless of HP. Can automatically enable hp tracking in the assist box. Also an option to show steals/morphs. To do so, sense an enemy (or auto sense), target it with the assist box open, then press switch+confirm for morph, or switch+cancel for steal. Also, if you target an enemy with an attack that steals or morphs, it will show its steal or morph without the button combo. Some enemies have multiple steals, but this will just show the first.

ConfigOption.Name: Show Effectiveness
ConfigOption.Description: Shows whether your target is weak, resists, absorbs, or is immune to the element of the attack you're using. Also shows if the target is immune to all statuses of your attack.

ConfigOption.Name: Show Bonuses on Equip Screen
ConfigOption.Description: Shows the effects of any hidden bonuses from your weapons and armor in the equip screen.

ConfigOption.Name: Battle Animation Skip
ConfigOption.Description: Lets you skip battle animations to save time. Will cause visual issues, like enemies not visually dying or being statused, and can make it hard to tell what's going on in general. Press L2/Camera while in battle to toggle if set to toggle. Toggle will carry over between fights. Interacts weirdly with sneak attack materia, and can crash the game with sneak attack 4x cut.

ConfigOption.Name: Dialogue Turbo
ConfigOption.Description: Allows you to turbo through dialogues. The way it's set up, it won't turbo unless you're in a dialogue, so it won't cause unintended mashing in battles or anywhere else. Turbo on Switch does mess with the piano playing sequence, so turn it off for that.

ConfigOption.Name: EXP Share
ConfigOption.Description: Lets you enable full growth for characters outside the party. Goes well with In-Battle PHS and Party Randomizer mods, since leveling the whole cast takes a lot of extra time, and materia growth slows to a crawl.

Option.Name: Inactive characters get full EXP and AP

ConfigOption.Name: Party Leader Override
ConfigOption.Description: Lets you change the party leader on the world map. Does not work anywhere else for now, since that's more complicated. The "First Character Slot" option chooses based on the top character slot in the menu, and defaults to Cloud if Tifa or Cid isn't there.

ConfigOption.Name: No Battle Music
ConfigOption.Description: Turns off battle music in random encounters.

Option.Name: No Battle Music in Fields or World Map

ConfigOption.Name: Specific Music Fix
ConfigOption.Description: Fixes the music timing on a certain late game story segment that has been messed up since the original pc port. If you don't know what I'm talking about, turn it on, it'll make that part much better. If you're using any music mods, this one will be out of place since it overwrites the music file, so I don't recommend it.

ConfigOption.Name: ======Balance Adjustments======
ConfigOption.Description: These options allow you to adjust the difficulty of the game in various ways, mostly to make it harder since the gameplay adjustments mostly make the game easier.

ConfigOption.Name: Enemy Stat Multiplier
ConfigOption.Description: Increases enemy stats by the chosen amount. The formula is meant to simulate the difference between enemies at different levels, so HP is scaled 3 times. Rewards are also scaled. Compatible with Randomizer.

ConfigOption.Name: Enemy Speed Multiplier
ConfigOption.Description: Increases enemy speed to make the game more challenging. Recommended at 2X if using True Wait, or you'll end up with a lot more turns than the enemies.

ConfigOption.Name: Progressive Level Cap
ConfigOption.Description: Limit your level gain based on story progress. The "Final Cap" will be the maximum level at the end of the game, with a bunch of smaller caps increasing throughout the story.

ConfigOption.Name: Easier Steals
ConfigOption.Description: Changes Steal formula. Steal is normally based on the level difference between you and the target. Can add luck to the calculation or just tweak the numbers.

Option.Name: Double Base Rate And Level Impact
Double Base Rate And Add Luck To Level

ConfigOption.Name: Status Speed Multiplier
ConfigOption.Description: Change how fast status effects tick. True Wait makes all status effects last much longer since they don't tick in the background, so this can help fix that. Double Speed is recommended for True Wait if you think normal is too slow, but you can adjust it however you want.

ConfigOption.Name: Fix Damage Overflow
ConfigOption.Description: Fixes the damage overflow glitch. This fix is automatically applied if using Unlimited Damage.

ConfigOption.Name: Fix W-Item Glitch
ConfigOption.Description: Fixes the infamous W-Item glitch. Now your item will be refunded when you press cancel to get out of the W-Item menu, instead of when canceling out of targeting for the second item. If using the randomizer, this will also lower W-Item's price drastically.

ConfigOption.Name: Morph Damage Adjuster
ConfigOption.Description: Change how much damage the Morph command does, relative to regular attack damage.

ConfigOption.Name: ======Mod Enablers======
ConfigOption.Description: These options don't do anything on their own. They simply enable features for other mods. For information on how to implement these into your own mod, check the Readme file.

ConfigOption.Name: Multi-Linked Slots Enabler
ConfigOption.Description: Enables materia slots to be linked to the slots to the left and right at the same time.

ConfigOption.Name: Morph As Well
ConfigOption.Description: Enables the "Morph as well" materia.

ConfigOption.Name: AP Plus
ConfigOption.Description: Enables the "AP Plus" materia.

ConfigOption.Name: Materia Drops
ConfigOption.Description: Lets you obtain materia in battle through steal, morph, and drops.

ConfigOption.Name: ======Compatibility Settings======
ConfigOption.Description: These settings enable compatibility with other mods. If not using the corresponding mods, these should be off.

ConfigOption.Name: SAC Compatibility
ConfigOption.Description: Enables compatibility with Shinra Archeology Cut.
